title: Karma Gane
subtitle: Songs of life & nature
description: Karma Gane ('Karma Songs') are sung during the Karma Festival, a celebration of trees and nature. Men and women sing and dance around a Karam branch planted in the village square, expressing joy, sorrow, and devotion to nature.

title: Sua Songs
subtitle: Women's parrot songs
description: Exclusively performed by women, Sua songs ('Parrot Songs') involve carrying a basket with a parrot idol on the head. The songs narrate stories of separation and longing, using the parrot as a messenger.

title: Traditional Archery
subtitle: Mastery of bow & arrow
description: More than a sport, archery is a survival skill and a cultural identity for the Pahadi Korwa tribe. It represents their deep connection with the forest and ancestral hunting traditions.
